Message.Title: Breaking News: Sales of BlackBerry phones in Indonesia and the Middle East have been successful - 30-40 million smartphones in 2013
Message.Msg: BlackBerry has recently stepped up its purchases of parts and components, including small-size LCD panels, from suppliers in Taiwan thanks to strong sales of BlackBerry 10 devices, according to sources in the supply chain. AU Optronics (AUO) and Innolux both are panel suppliers for BlackBerry, but the two companies declined to comment on orders from individual clients. Initial sales of BlackBerry 10 smartphones, particularly the BlackBerry Q10 which comes with a QWERTY keyboard, in the US and Europe have been strong, lifting market sentiment for BlackBerry, said the sources. Component suppliers in Taiwan believe that BlackBerry is likely to further expand the BlackBerry family by releasing entry-level and mid-range BlackBerry 10 models for emerging markets in the second half of 2013. Sales of BlackBerry phones in Indonesia and the Middle East have been successful, and if the business model can be replicated in other emerging markets, the vendor is likely to ship 30-40 million smartphones in 2013, estimated the sources. Source : Digitimes

Topic.Title: The Latest Report Claiming That Obamacare Hikes Premiums

Message.Msg: " ... that ALWAYS happened with Pre-Existing conditions in a PMO ... you pay more ..." right, idiot, please, please, please learn to read before attempting a response. ***YOU*** pay more when discovered with pre-existing, which is the incentive for *YOU* to buy insurance before such a condition is doscovered. With the new Obamacare you wait until the condition is discovered then *WE* pay more to cover *YOU*. In the interim, before *YOU* need the coverage *YOU* save on premiums that should be going into a treatment kitty, then *WE* have to make up for the money *YOU* kept in a saving account, just another way to redistribute money from the responsible to the less responsible, which I realize makes lazy deadbeats like you happy.

Topic.Title: Which skirt was Bill Clinton chasing the SIX times he turned down Osama bin Laden?

Message.Msg: That is a lie. The primary reason Bin Ladin stayed alive is the military decision chain was too slow - from the time he was spotted, to the green light to shoot, took too long, and it took too long within the military chain. The military was too slow, and too cautious. You can maybe blame Clinton for allowing that to happen - for not making a quick response a priority, but at that point who knew what Bin Ladin was up to - Bush certainly was asleep at the switch - he SPECIFICALLY WARNED OF A PENDING TERRIORIST STIKE, AND HE STAYED ON VACATION.
